taskbody.context: This procedure customizes key configuration variables of .
Perform this procedure on each resource pool host in your deployment.

step.cmd: Log in to the resource pool host .
Configure as an agent of the master host.

info.p: The following variable configures serviced to serve as agent:
In addition, replace {{SERVICED_MASTER_IP}} with HA-Virtual-IP, the virtual IP address of the high-availability cluster, in the following lines::

substep.cmd: Find the SERVICED_AGENT declaration, and then change the value from 0 to 1.
substep.stepxmp: The following example shows the line to change: # SERVICED_AGENT=0

substep.cmd: Find the SERVICED_MASTER declaration, and then remove the number sign character (#) from the beginning of the line.
Globally replace {{SERVICED_MASTER_IP}} with the virtual IP address of the high-availability cluster (HA-Virtual-IP).

info.note: Remove the number sign character (#) from the beginning of each variable declaration that includes the virtual IP address.

step.cmd: Specify an alternate private network for , if necessary.

info.p: requires a 16-bit, private IPv4 network for virtual IP addresses, independent of the private network used in a dual-NIC DRBD configuration. The default network is 10.3/16. If the default network is already in use in your environment, you may select any valid IPv4 16-bit network.
The following variable configures serviced to use an alternate network:

substep.cmd: Locate the SERVICED_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS_SUBNET declaration, and then change the value.
substep.stepxmp: The following example shows the line to change: # SERVICED_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS_SUBNET=10.3

step.info: To monitor progress, open a separate window to the host, and then enter the following command: journalctl -flu serviced -o cat
